reviews.title: Wonderful 2009 New Year in Paris
reviews.text: When my husband announced that we are spending New Year in Paris, I immediately browsed thru the internet for a hotel. After reading the different hotel reviews at Tripadvisor I booked Hotel d l'Arcade with Venere.com. I chose this hotel for its near proximity to MTR, historic sites( Madelaine Church, Concord Place) and shopping areas(Champ Elysees, St. Honore and Gallerias Lafayette). My family and I were not disappointed. In fact, when we checked in, they gave us a bigger room, than what I booked for and without any additional cost. It also has a big bathroom. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel staff were very helpful and attentive to all our needs. We also appreciated the chocolates that were given to us on New Year's Eve. We enjoyed celebrating New Year in Paris despite the very cold temperature and for Hotel d l'Arcade for making it memorable.

The Hotel de l'Arcade was everything we hoped it would be. The hotel was very central - walking distance of the Louvre, Place de L'Concorde, Galleries Lafyette, The Seine and Musee Dorsay. Three minutes from Madeleine Metro.

reviews.title: Surprising Quality for a 3-Star Hotel in Paris
reviews.text: This was a wonderful hotel with a spacious room and 2 large windows overlooking the street. The best part of our visit to Paris was this hotel. Watch out for the pickpockets!! They are rampant. They got our camera out of a zipped bag that was attached at the waist. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They even made coffee for us at 6:30 am when we had a day trip.

reviews.title: Confortable Hotel Near All My Personal Fav
reviews.text: Stayed twice, two nights in late July and two again in early August, 2006 and was surprised by the quality of this well-situated hotel near La Madeleine. The room was large by Paris standards, the air conditioning worked well, the double-paned windows provided good sound insulation from city sounds for undisturbed sleeping and the bathroom was well appointed with a tub/shower and a shower curtain. Appears to have been subject of a major remodel and upgrade within the last 10 years but still well maintained and in good repair with only a few, minor exceptions that did not diminish the enjoyment of my stays. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lobby area was understated but very attractive as was the breakfast room, with the breakfast offerings above average and more than adequate. Only 41 rooms, so it has an intimate feel. Sister hotel to Hotel Bedford, a larger, 4-star property about 1/2 block up the street. Convenient location, only a very short walk to Madeleine metro station and with taxi stand close by. Quite comfortable and a good qualtiy/cost value.

Stay here whenever I can. Near friends and business or walk to shops or meetings. Clean, comfortable and easy to get on Metro, or did I mention shop. You can pay alot more and get alot less for your money in Paris. The staff is always helpful and professional.

reviews.title: Good reliable hotel in excellent position

reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to France and Italy with our 3 adult children. Our first two nights were spent in this hotel in Paris. We had a double room in the new part of the hotel and our kids were in a triple in the original part. Our rooms were ready although we arrived early, but they do have a luggage drop-off if needed. Rooms are beautiful, exceptionally clean, and wi-fi is available. Beds are typical for Europe: very firm, but this is what we expected. All linens were excellent, and terry cloth towels were exchanged daily. Nice toiletries were provided. We had wash clothes the first night, but they were not replaced, so hang on to them. (Wash clothes are rarely provided in Europe, so this was a real treat.) Rooms came equipped with hair dryers and air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Beautiful, quiet hotel in Paris

reviews.text: The male staff is not rude, just very formal, but the female desk staff is very welcoming and helpful, really terrific. They never hesitated to call a cab, or give advice.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Exhausted after visiting the Eiffel tower and the Place de la Concorde, we ate our first evening meal in Paris at Pompeii, which is just a block away from the hotel. Surprisingly good pizza and good wine selection. Very hectic, though, with typical French wait-staff attitude, which you learn to take in stride. It is owned by an Italian family, and they are more friendly. Breakfast is really expensive at the hotel, and nothing special. We walked down the street to the patisserie for some wonderful espresso, croissants and a great view of Parisians. It is across the street from Pompeii. On our second night, we asked for a restaurant recommendation for a contemporary French meal, not an easy task for a Sunday. A half-hour later, the desk person called to say that she had made reservations for us at La Cuisine and had arranged for a taxi to pick us up. We were so impressed by her thoughtfulness, and the restaurant was such a wonderful experience.
